contentrichtext.text: {{pp-semi-protected|small=yes}} {{wiktionary|hooker}} '''Hooker''' may refer to: {{tocright}} ==People== * [[Hooker (surname)]] * [[Hooker Jim]] (1851–1879), Modoc (Native American) warrior ==Places== *[[Hooker, Kentucky]] * [[Hooker, Missouri]], a ghost town * [[Hooker County, Nebraska]] * [[Hooker Township, Dixon County, Nebraska]] * [[Hooker Township, Gage County, Nebraska]] * [[Hooker, Oklahoma]], a city * Hooker, [[Turner County, South Dakota]] * [[Hooker Dam]], a proposed dam on the Gila River in New Mexico * [[Hooker Falls]], North Carolina * [[Hooker River]], New Zealand * [[Hooker Glacier]], a glacier in the Southern Alps of New Zealand * [[Hooker Island]] in Franz Josef Land, Russia * [[Mount Hooker (disambiguation)]] * [[Cape Hooker (Antarctica)]] * [[Cape Hooker (South Shetland Islands)]] ==Sport== * [[Hooker (rugby league)]], one of the positions in rugby league football * Hooker, one of the [[rugby union positions]] * In cricket, a batsman who plays the [[Batting (cricket)#Pull and hook|hook shot]] * An expert practitioner of [[catch wrestling]] * Title of [[Lou Thesz]]'s book on professional wrestling (1916–2002) ==Other== * A colloquial term for a [[prostitute]] * "Hooker", a song by Pink from the album ''[[Try This]]'' * The {{convert|100|in|mm|adj=on}} Hooker Telescope at [[Mount Wilson Observatory]] * [[Galway hooker]], a traditional Irish fishing boat * The [[Hooker Emerald Brooch|Hooker Emerald]], a {{convert|75|carat|g|adj=on}} emerald on display by the Smithsonian Institution as of 2010 {{disambiguation}}
